bibl.title: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 19, 1927

div1.p: Kibler thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the clippings she provided regarding Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from J. Luther Kibler to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 19, 1927
div1.opener:
P. O. Box 470,
Newport News, Va.
August 19, 1927.
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Blue Ridge Summitt,
Pennsylvania.
Dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
Your letter with clippings received. It is just too bad that you
have lost the records you prized so much. I can appreciate your disappointment, for
I have had similar experiences in the loss of papers, books, etc. that can never be
duplicated, or restored. Possibly the genealogy of the Reed family can be gotten
again from court house records in North Carolina,--in a measure, at least. It is to
hoped that this is possible.

Now, as soon as I can make memoranda from the data you sent me I will return
all the papers. These clippings, it would seem could be best preserved in a “Scrap-
Book”. If you say so, I would like to mount them in a bound book of that kind, pro-
vided I can find such here. I use something of this type myself. I am a kind of “book-
binder”, in the sense that I make my own books “to order”--Scrap books.

Dr. Jones has loaned me copy od Va. Med. Monthly, with a valuable article on
Dr. Reed and his work. I enclose copy of a little Free Lance News article, which I
sent to Richmond, Washington, and Roanoke.
